name: Something similar to RokuLiuYeoseot- Nacci
description: We have the following recursive function: The 15-th term; ```f(14)``` is the first term in having more that 100 digits. In fact, ``` f(14) = 2596253046576879973769082409566059879570061514363339324718953988724415850732046186170181072783243503881471037546575506836249417271830960970629933033088 It has 151 digits. ``` Make the function ```something_acci()```, that receives ```num_dig``` (number of digits of the value) as unique argument. ```something_acci()``` will output a tuple/array with the ordinal number in the sequence for the least value in having equal or more than the given number of digits. Let's see some cases: ```python something_acci(20) == (12, 25) # f(11) = 1422313222839141753028416 something_acci(100) == (15, 151) ``` ```ruby something_acci(20) == [12, 25] # f(11) = 1422313222839141753028416 something_acci(100) == [15, 151] ``` The number of digits given will be always more than 5. ```num_dig > 5```. Happy coding!!! And the name for this kata? You have three words of the same meaning in Asian Languages.
